message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you a unique and valuable product that I think you'll really like. Would you like to make an offer on it?
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $100. Can you meet me at that price?
I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob, but I'm not sure I can meet you at $100. How about we meet in the middle at $110? I think that's a fair price for this unique item.
I'm still a bit hesitant about the price. How about we meet at $105? I think that's a more reasonable price for this product.

I'm glad you're still interested in the product, Bob! I can see you're a savvy negotiator. I'm willing to meet you at $108, but that's as low as I can go. I think it's a fair price considering the value this product brings
I'm not sure I'm comfortable with $108. Can you meet me at $106? I'm willing to pay a premium for the product, but I'm not sure I can go that high.

I can see you're trying to get a good deal, Bob. I'm willing to meet you at $107, but that's the last concession I can make. I think it's a fair price for the product, and I'm confident you'll be happy with it.
I'm not willing to go that high. I can only go up to $105. I think that's a fair price considering the product's value.

I've already met you at $107 and you rejected it, now you're back at $105? I'm starting to think we're not on the same page, Bob. I'm willing to make one last offer, but I'm not budging from $109. That's the lowest I can go

I'm not willing to pay $109. I think we've been negotiating for a while and I'm not seeing any flexibility from your end. I'm willing to meet you at $105, but that's my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to consider other options.
